intro: Pouzolzia guatemalana, commonly known as Guatemalan pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. Pouzolzia guatemalana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
